greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of terms (including the initial term) needed to reach a palindrome when the Reverse Then Add! map (x -> x + (x-with-digits-reversed)) is repeatedly applied to n, or -1 if a palindrome is never reached.
comment: It is conjectured that a(196) is the smallest term equal to -1. See A023108.
reference: Daniel Lignon, Dictionnaire de (presque) tous les nombres entiers, Ellipses, Paris, 2012, 702 pages. See Entry 196.
link: Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, 196 Algorithm.
mathematica: NestWhileList[# + IntegerReverse[#] &, n, ! PalindromeQ[#]  &], {n, 98}] (* _Robert Price_, Oct 18 2019 *)
results.author: _Eric W. Weisstein_
ext: Edited by _N. J. A. Sloane_, May 09 2015
